meanings.definition: To construct or prototype electronic circuits on a breadboard.
meanings.sent1: I breadboarded a simple circuit for my science project.
meanings.sent2: She breadboarded the circuit before soldering it onto a PCB.
meanings.sent3: The robot breadboarded its own circuits to learn how they work.
meanings.sent4: His mind breadboarded ideas before putting them into action.
meanings.sent5: The students breadboarded their inventions in the classroom, sparking creativity.

meanings.definition: To temporarily assemble or test a circuit using a breadboard.
meanings.sent1: We breadboarded the circuit to check for any errors.
meanings.sent2: They breadboarded the prototype to ensure it worked correctly.
meanings.sent3: The cat breadboarded the circuit, thinking it was a new toy.
meanings.sent4: The idea breadboarded in his mind until he was ready to implement it.
meanings.sent5: The team breadboarded the design, making adjustments for better performance.

meanings.definition: The act of using a breadboard for circuit design or testing.
meanings.sent1: His breadboarding of the project was meticulous and precise.
meanings.sent2: The breadboarding process helped them understand the circuit better.
meanings.sent3: The breadboarded circuit looked like a mini city of wires and components.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity soared as she engaged in breadboarding sessions.
meanings.sent5: The efficiency of the breadboarding saved time during the testing phase.
